meanings.definition: A device that causes light waves to vibrate in a single plane.
meanings.sent1: The polarizers in sunglasses help reduce glare by filtering out certain light waves.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use polarizers in microscopes to study the properties of light.
meanings.sent3: The polarizers at the 3D movie theater made the images look so real!
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor acted as a polarizer in the heated debate, bringing focus to the main points.
meanings.sent5: The polarizers in photography lenses enhance the colors in the landscape, making them more vibrant.

meanings.sent1: The special film on the windows acts as polarizers, reducing the intensity of light entering the room.
meanings.sent2: Certain crystals can act as polarizers, changing the direction of light waves passing through them.
meanings.sent3: The polarizers in the glasses made everything look like a rainbow!
meanings.sent4: Her positive energy acted as a polarizer, brightening the mood of everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The polarizers in the camera lens help photographers capture clear images even in bright sunlight.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that polarizes opinions or attitudes.
meanings.sent1: The politician was a polarizer, with people either strongly supporting or opposing his views.
meanings.sent2: The controversial movie became a polarizer, sparking debates among viewers.
meanings.sent3: The new dessert was a polarizer at the party, with some loving it and others finding it too sweet.
meanings.sent4: Her bold fashion choices acted as a polarizer, with some admiring her style and others criticizing it.
meanings.sent5: The art exhibition was a polarizer in the community, drawing both praise and criticism for its unconventional pieces.
